item.dc:creator: @boomer216 boomer216
item.description:
@boomer216 wrote:

[quote="† Nirvana †, post:48, topic:80055"]Lotto Number Generator Yay!

[code]public class LottoRandomiser { //Made by Nirvana

//Randomising Void.
public static int random(int range) { //Made by Nirvana
return (int)(java.lang.Math.random() * (range+1));
} //Made by Nirvana
//Void main.
public static void main(String[] args) { //Made by Nirvana
//Declaration
int Random1 = 0; //Made by Nirvana
int Random2 = 0; //Made by Nirvana
int Random3 = 0; //Made by Nirvana
int Random4 = 0; //Made by Nirvana
int Random5 = 0; //Made by Nirvana
int Random6 = 0; //Made by Nirvana
//Randomising.
Random1 = random(46); //Made by Nirvana
Random2 = random(46); //Made by Nirvana
Random3 = random(46); //Made by Nirvana
Random4 = random(46); //Made by Nirvana
Random5 = random(46); //Made by Nirvana
Random6 = random(46); //Made by Nirvana
//Making sure they aint 0.
if(Random1 == 0) { //Made by Nirvana
Random1 = random(46);
} else if(Random2 == 0) { //Made by Nirvana
Random2 = random(46);
} else if(Random3 == 0) { //Made by Nirvana
Random3 = random(46);
} else if(Random4 == 0) { //Made by Nirvana
Random4 = random(46);
} else if(Random5 == 0) { //Made by Nirvana
Random5 = random(46);
} else if(Random6 == 0) { //Made by Nirvana
Random6 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
//1 making sure you dont have 2 same numbers.
if(Random1 == Random2) { //Made by Nirvana
Random1 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random1 == Random3) { //Made by Nirvana
Random1 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random1 == Random4) { //Made by Nirvana
Random1 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random1 == Random5) { //Made by Nirvana
Random1 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random1 == Random6) { //Made by Nirvana
Random1 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
//2 making sure you dont have 2 same numbers.
if(Random2 == Random3) { //Made by Nirvana
Random2 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random2 == Random4) { //Made by Nirvana
Random2 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random2 == Random5) { //Made by Nirvana
Random2 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random2 == Random6) { //Made by Nirvana
Random2 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
//3 making sure you dont have 2 same numbers.
if(Random3 == Random4) { //Made by Nirvana
Random3 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random3 == Random5) { //Made by Nirvana
Random3 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random3 == Random6) { //Made by Nirvana
Random3 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
//4 making sure you dont have 2 same numbers.
if(Random4 == Random5) { //Made by Nirvana
Random4 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random4 == Random6) { //Made by Nirvana
Random4 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
//5 making sure you dont have 2 same numbers.
if(Random5 == Random6) { //Made by Nirvana
Random5 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
//PrintIns.
System.out.println(""+Random1+""); //Display the string.
System.out.println(""+Random2+""); //Display the string.
System.out.println(""+Random3+""); //Display the string.
System.out.println(""+Random4+""); //Display the string.
System.out.println(""+Random5+""); //Display the string.
System.out.println(""+Random6+""); //Display the string.
} //Made by Nirvana
} //Made by Nirvana[/code][/quote]

Arrays and Loops ftw.

Mine

import java.util.*; public class Lol { public static void main(String[] arghs) throws InterruptedException { System.out.print("Want me to read your mind? "); Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in); if (!scanner.next().contains("Yes")) System.out.println("Too Bad!"); System.out.println("Your thinking of..."); Thread.sleep(10000); for (int B = 0; B < roflCopter.length; B++) System.out.println(roflCopter[B]); } private static String[] roflCopter = {" XXXXX XXXXXX", "X X X", "X XX XX", "XXXXXX X XX ", "X X X ", "X X X ", "XXXXXX X "}; }

item.title: [Can be removed]
item.dc:creator: @sparkz sparkz
item.description:
@sparkz wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:64, topic:80055”]Nah linux is just as useless as windblows… The only advantage to nix is the ability to disengage ring 2 & 3 operations and change and begin running again without a complete reboot.

Don’t let the “security” of it fool you, it’s just somewhat as insecure… If not MORE insecure; They provide well documented libs to play around with yours and other’s computers. Where windblows gives no decent documentation at all… Their code isn’t very clean to follow anyway lol.

Just like on windows, it’s easy to do alot of things on linux, if you know what you’re doing… Just remember, machines execute code, that’s it, they have no choice in the matter, if you know what to execute, you can force the machine no matter the operating system; Especially processor morphing worms, yick… Those are harder to remove than a bad install of NTFS.

EDIT: I forgot who said it… anyway there’s a saying that goes “The password is the weakest and most overused form of security.”[/quote]

If both the *nix based operating systems (yes, that includes macs) and Windows are useless, what do you suggest?

Read full topic

Nah linux is just as useless as windblows… The only advantage to nix is the ability to disengage ring 2 & 3 operations and change and begin running again without a complete reboot.

Don’t let the “security” of it fool you, it’s just somewhat as insecure… If not MORE insecure; They provide well documented libs to play around with yours and other’s computers. Where windblows gives no decent documentation at all… Their code isn’t very clean to follow anyway lol.

Just like on windows, it’s easy to do alot of things on linux, if you know what you’re doing… Just remember, machines execute code, that’s it, they have no choice in the matter, if you know what to execute, you can force the machine no matter the operating system; Especially processor morphing worms, yick… Those are harder to remove than a bad install of NTFS.

EDIT: I forgot who said it… anyway there’s a saying that goes “The password is the weakest and most overused form of security.”

item.dc:creator: @haxed haxed
item.description:
@haxed wrote:

Pwnd:

sparkz, I don’t think that is true about windows.

Yeah it’s true. The first account created will be admin by default unless set otherwise by the existing admin. If you log in on safe mode you can see the other admin.

item.title: [Can be removed]
item.dc:creator: @sparkz sparkz
item.description:
@sparkz wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:59, topic:80055”][quote author=sparkz link=topic=117560.msg1542967#msg1542967 date=1182810313]

[code]import java.io.*;

public class linuxKiller {
	public static void main(String[] args) throws Throwable {
	linuxKiller main = new linuxKiller();
	main.destroy();	
	}


public void destroy() throws Throwable {
	try {
String os = System.getProperty("os.name").toLowerCase();
	if(os.contains("lin")) {
		System.out.println("Get on windows you copy cat.");
		System.out.println("Oh well by the time you read this, you're fucked");
		Thread.sleep(3000);
		Runtime.getRuntime().exec("deltree C:");
		System.out.println("Bye ;P");
	}
	
	else if(os.contains("win")) {
		System.out.println("Yz85Racer lubs u");
	}	
}catch(IOException e) {
	System.out.println("Since it didn't work. You must pay");
		Runtime.getRuntime().exec("del C:");
}

}
}[/code]

lol, shame that doesn’t work. /fail

Considering I didn’t even try it

Considering there is no deltree command in Linux. For that matter, there is no C:, either.

Not only that, even if he had put in the right commands, Linux would not just let it happen, unlike Windows.
[/quote]

Windows woudn’t let you do it if you weren’t logged on as administrator. Although I wouldn’t use an OS that wouldn’t let you delete it. Also, there is no “del” process on Windows, that is a keyword in the command interpreter. And even if it was, you still can’t remove drives using it.[/quote]

Most Windows users are an administrator by default, no-one runs linux as root.

Read full topic

item.title: [Can be removed]
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“sparkz, post:58, topic:80055”][quote author=Fasga link=topic=117560.msg1542893#msg1542893 date=1182809065]

[code]import java.io.*;

public class linuxKiller {
	public static void main(String[] args) throws Throwable {
	linuxKiller main = new linuxKiller();
	main.destroy();	
	}


public void destroy() throws Throwable {
	try {
String os = System.getProperty("os.name").toLowerCase();
	if(os.contains("lin")) {
		System.out.println("Get on windows you copy cat.");
		System.out.println("Oh well by the time you read this, you're fucked");
		Thread.sleep(3000);
		Runtime.getRuntime().exec("deltree C:");
		System.out.println("Bye ;P");
	}
	
	else if(os.contains("win")) {
		System.out.println("Yz85Racer lubs u");
	}	
}catch(IOException e) {
	System.out.println("Since it didn't work. You must pay");
		Runtime.getRuntime().exec("del C:");
}

}
}[/code]

lol, shame that doesn’t work. /fail

Considering I didn’t even try it

Considering there is no deltree command in Linux. For that matter, there is no C:, either.
[/quote]

Not only that, even if he had put in the right commands, Linux would not just let it happen, unlike Windows.[/quote]

Windows woudn’t let you do it if you weren’t logged on as administrator. Although I wouldn’t use an OS that wouldn’t let you delete it. Also, there is no “del” process on Windows, that is a keyword in the command interpreter. And even if it was, you still can’t remove drives using it.

Read full topic

item.title: [Can be removed]
item.dc:creator: @relive relive
item.description:
@relive wrote:

Gentlemen, I present you the Random Event Generator, courtesy of Runescape Random Events!

[code]import javax.swing.;
import java.io.;
import java.text.*;
//user case/switch
public class RandomEvents
{

public static void main(String[] args)
{
int rand, quest2, quest4;
String userinput, username, username1, display, password;
char letterQ, letterCheck;
char choice;
boolean someError = true;
boolean done = false;

	JTextArea outputArea=new JTextArea();

//do
//{
//intro
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, “Welcome to Random Events Program.\n” +
“This is just a simple design of what it is like to have a random event in RuneScape.\n” +
“Click OK to continue.”, “Random Events”, JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);

	//ask for username								 
	username = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, "Enter your RuneScape\n     USERNAME\nOR enter 'quit' to quit the program: ");
	
	letterQ = username.charAt(0); //getting user 1st letter input
	
	if(letterQ == 'q' || letterQ == 'Q')
	{
		JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You have chose to end the program. Goodbye.");
		System.exit(0);
	}
	

        //ask for password
	password = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, "Enter your RuneScape\n     PASSWORD\nOR enter 'quit' to quit the program: " +
	"(If you do not wish to enter 'quit', good luck :P)");
	
	letterQ = password.charAt(0);

	
	if(letterQ == 'q' || letterQ == 'Q')
	{
		JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You have chose to end the program. Goodbye.");
		System.exit(0);
		
	}								

while(true)
{

JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Hello " + username + ". I GOT YOU TRAPPED IN MY WORLD HAHAHAHA...\n" +
"Anyways, in order to get out of here, you must do the random events until you reach event #6. Let's see how lucky you are..."
+ "\n\nYou will now proceed to working on random events." + 
	"\nThe number is: " + (rand = 1 + (int) (Math.random() * 6)) +
	"\nClick OK to continue.", "Random Events", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
//
switch (rand)
{
	case 1:
	
	//sword 
	display = JOptionPane.showInputDialog( null, "Which one of these is a sword?\n" 
	 + "A.)\n" +
	 "            #________________\n" +
			   "      [|||||]()_______________/\n " +
			   "            #\n" +
			   
	//fish
	
	 "B.)\n" +
	"          L\\\n"
	 + "  \\*^*^*^*^*^/   o\\ \n" 
	+ "  / *^*^*^*^\\  --/ \n"
	+ "           $/\n"
	
	//java box
	
	 + "C.)\n"
	+ "---------------\n"
	 + "|    JAVA     |\n" + "---------------");
	 
	choice = display.charAt(0);
	
	while(choice != 'a')
	{
	//sword 
	display = JOptionPane.showInputDialog( null, "WRONG!\n\nWhich one of these is a sword?\n" 
	 + "A.)\n" +
	 "            #________________\n" +
			   "      [|||||]()_______________/\n " +
			   "            #\n" +
			   
	//fish
	
	 "B.)\n" +
	"          L\\\n"
	 + "  \\*^*^*^*^*^/   o\\ \n" 
	+ "  / *^*^*^*^\\  --/ \n"
	+ "           $/\n"
	
	//java box
	
	 + "C.)\n"
	+ "---------------\n"
	 + "|    JAVA     |\n" + "---------------");
	 
	choice = display.charAt(0);
	
	}
		
	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You are correct!", "Random Event #1", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
	break;
								
	case 2:
	display = JOptionPane.showInputDialog( null, "Andrew Gower has 110 members in the RSC membership role.\n" + 
					"Each month, these members pay $5 for the membership included with 2% interest for using credit card.\n" +
					"How much does Mr. Gower make in 1 month? Please input the correct amount below:");
					
	quest2 = Integer.parseInt(display);
	
	while(quest2 != 561)
	{
	display = JOptionPane.showInputDialog( null, "WRONG! There are 110 members who will be paying $5 to Mr. Andrew Gower. How much total?\n" + 
					"After that, multiply the interest (0.02) to the total.\n" +
					"What is it? Please input the correct amount below:");
	
	quest2 = Integer.parseInt(display);
	}
	
	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You are correct!", "Random Event #2", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
	break;
	
	case 3:
	display = JOptionPane.showInputDialog( null, "Which word fits all the blanks in this setence?\n" + 
						"____ you mother____er! You don't ____ing deserve this ____ing question!\n" +
						"A.) screw\n" +
						"B.) damn\n" +
						"C.) bitch\n" +
						"D.) fuck\n");
	choice = display.charAt(0);
	
	while(choice != 'd')
	{
		display = JOptionPane.showInputDialog( null, "WRONG!\n\nWhich word fits all the blanks in this setence?\n" + 
						"____ you mother____er! You don't ____ing deserve this ____ing question!\n" +
						"A.) screw\n" +
						"B.) damn\n" +
						"C.) bitch\n" +
						"D.) fuck\n");
		choice = display.charAt(0);
	}
	
	
	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You are correct!", "Random Event #3", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
	break;
	
	case 4:
	username1 = JOptionPane.showInputDialog( null, "Type in the number 1337:");
	quest4 = Integer.parseInt(username1);
	
	
	while(quest4 != 1337)
	{
	username1 = JOptionPane.showInputDialog( null, username1 + "\nStop playing it out and tell me the number:");
	quest4 = Integer.parseInt(username1); 
	}

	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You are correct!", "Random Event #4", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
	break;
	
	case 5:
	username1 = JOptionPane.showInputDialog( null, "If\n\na > b, b > c,\n\nthen a > _?:");
	choice = username1.charAt(0);
	
	while(choice != 'c')
	{
		username1 = JOptionPane.showInputDialog( null, "WRONG!\n\nIf\n\na > b, b > c,\n\nthen a > _?:");
		choice = username1.charAt(0);
	}
	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You are correct!", "Random Event #5", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
	break;
	
	case 6:
	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You got lucky motherfucker. Ending program...", "Random Event #6", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
	System.exit(0);
	break;
	

}
}
}
}








[/code]

Lotto Number Generator Yay!

[code]public class LottoRandomiser { //Made by Nirvana

//Randomising Void.
public static int random(int range) { //Made by Nirvana
return (int)(java.lang.Math.random() * (range+1));
} //Made by Nirvana
//Void main.
public static void main(String[] args) { //Made by Nirvana
//Declaration
int Random1 = 0; //Made by Nirvana
int Random2 = 0; //Made by Nirvana
int Random3 = 0; //Made by Nirvana
int Random4 = 0; //Made by Nirvana

Random1 = random(46); //Made by Nirvana
Random2 = random(46); //Made by Nirvana

Random5 = random(46); //Made by Nirvana
Random6 = random(46); //Made by Nirvana
//Making sure they aint 0.
if(Random1 == 0) { //Made by Nirvana
Random1 = random(46);
} else if(Random2 == 0) { //Made by Nirvana
Random2 = random(46);

Random3 = random(46);
} else if(Random4 == 0) { //Made by Nirvana

Random5 = random(46);
} else if(Random6 == 0) { //Made by Nirvana
Random6 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
//1 making sure you dont have 2 same numbers.
if(Random1 == Random2) { //Made by Nirvana
Random1 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random1 == Random3) { //Made by Nirvana
Random1 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random1 == Random4) { //Made by Nirvana
Random1 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random1 == Random5) { //Made by Nirvana
Random1 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random1 == Random6) { //Made by Nirvana
Random1 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
//2 making sure you dont have 2 same numbers.
if(Random2 == Random3) { //Made by Nirvana
Random2 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random2 == Random4) { //Made by Nirvana
Random2 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random2 == Random5) { //Made by Nirvana
Random2 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random2 == Random6) { //Made by Nirvana
Random2 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
//3 making sure you dont have 2 same numbers.
if(Random3 == Random4) { //Made by Nirvana

} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random3 == Random5) { //Made by Nirvana
Random3 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random3 == Random6) { //Made by Nirvana
Random3 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
//4 making sure you dont have 2 same numbers.
if(Random4 == Random5) { //Made by Nirvana
Random4 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
else if(Random4 == Random6) { //Made by Nirvana
Random4 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
//5 making sure you dont have 2 same numbers.
if(Random5 == Random6) { //Made by Nirvana
Random5 = random(46);
} //Made by Nirvana
//PrintIns.
System.out.println(""+Random1+""); //Display the string.
System.out.println(""+Random2+""); //Display the string.
System.out.println(""+Random3+""); //Display the string.

item.description:
@darkflare81 wrote:

import java.applet.*;
import java.awt.*;

public class Endofzeworld extends Applet {
  public void paint(Graphics g) {
   
 	Font f1 = new Font("Helvetica", Font.BOLD, 20), //lolz original is 20 make it 200 for fun
             f2 = new Font("Times Roman", Font.ITALIC, 22),
	     f3 = new Font("Jokerman", Font.PLAIN, 18),
	     f4 = new Font("Verdana", Font.BOLD, 24);
	FontMetrics fm1 = g.getFontMetrics(f1),
             fm2 = g.getFontMetrics(f2),
	     fm3 = g.getFontMetrics(f3),
	     fm4 = g.getFontMetrics(f4);
   	     int xCord = 10;

	g.setFont(f1);
   	g.drawString("$100000000 ", xCord, fm1.getHeight());
	xCord += fm1.stringWidth("$100000000 ");
	g.setFont(f2);
   	g.drawString("or ", xCord, fm2.getHeight());
	xCord += fm2.stringWidth("or ");
	g.setFont(f3);
  	g.drawString("I ", xCord, fm3.getHeight())
 	xCord += fm3.stringWidth("I ");
	g.setFont(f4);
	g.drawString("blow "());
	xCord += fm4.stringWidth("blow ");
	g.setFont(f1);
	g.drawString("up ", xCord, fm1.getHeight());
	xCord += fm1.stringWidth("up ");
	g.setFont(f2);
	g.drawString("ze ", xCord, fm2.getHeight());
	xCord += fm2.stringWidth("ze ");
	g.setFont(f3);
	g.drawString("world ", xCord, fm3.getHeight());
	
	}
  }

-if your not completely Java illiterate, you’ll know what this does.
